intro: Helichrysum pinifolium, commonly known as the golden everlasting or needle-leaved immortelle, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It is characterized by its compact, shrub-like growth habit and its distinctive, needle-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, yellow to orange flowers that are tightly clustered in cylindrical inflorescences. It is well adapted to dry, sunny environments and is often found in rocky or sandy soils. Helichrysum pinifolium is also valued for its ornamental appeal and is used in floral arrangements due to its long-lasting flowers.
